intro: Odontarrhena mughlaei, commonly known as the Afghan dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces achenes as its seed dispersal mechanism. Odontarrhena mughlaei is often found in rocky soils and is a component of the local flora in its native habitat.
